items.title: India’s CarTrade shares rise 11% as market rallies on tariff pause
No IPO jitters for Fore Coffee
Trump tariffs threaten US services trade surplus with China
items.summary:
- China is considering restrictions on US services exports due to US tariffs.
- Key impacted sectors include education, travel, and entertainment.
- In 2023, the US had a $32 billion services trade surplus with China.
- Major US services exports to China include education, travel, intellectual property, and entertainment.
- [Source: Bloomberg](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-04-11/trump-tariffs-put-us-services-trade-surplus-with-china-at-risk)

items.title: Ripple, US SEC suspend appeals to seek settlement
items.summary:
- Ripple Labs and the SEC filed a joint motion to pause ongoing legal appeals on April 11, 2025, for 60 days to pursue a potential settlement.
- They reached an agreement-in-principle pending SEC approval, addressing both the SEC's appeal and Ripple's cross-appeal.
- The legal dispute began in 2020, focusing on the SEC's claim that Ripple's sale of XRP tokens violated federal securities laws.

items.title: Kakao struggles with ongoing unit selloff rumors
items.summary:
- Kakao faces speculation about selling stakes in subsidiaries, which the company denied but acknowledged ongoing discussions.
- Kakao Entertainment's co-CEOs stated reports of a potential sale were misrepresented, with no decisions made yet.
- Kakao Entertainment reported a net loss of 259.1 billion won (approximately US$180.58 million) for 2024, raising financial stability concerns.
- VIG Partners is reportedly interested in acquiring a 40% stake in Kakao Mobility, potentially impacting Kakao’s management control.
- Speculations about selling the web portal Daum persist, despite CEO Chung Shin-a denying such intentions.
- Kakao's labor union insisted on protection against selling platforms that handle sensitive user data, highlighting trust issues with management.

items.title: Meet the 20 top-funded startups and tech companies in Hong Kong
Chinese yuan weakens to record low since 2007
items.summary:
- The Chinese yuan has reached its lowest value since 2007.
- The depreciation reflects ongoing economic pressures within China.
- Experts are discussing potential impacts on international trade and the global economy.

items.title: China raises tariffs to 125% in response to US hike
items.summary:
- China has increased tariffs on US goods to 125% as a response to the US raising duties on Chinese imports to 145%.
- This tariff hike is part of a larger ongoing trade dispute that is disrupting global supply chains.
- China’s Finance Ministry condemned the US actions, labeling them as unilateral and coercive, claiming they breach international trade rules.
- There has been no clear path provided by either nation toward resolving the escalating trade conflict.
- Historical context shows current tariffs are exceptionally high compared to norms established after WWII, deviating from decades of trade liberalization.
- Supply chain diversification efforts by US companies have been undermined by the new tariffs, complicating production strategies.

items.title: Yahoo removes DEI pages, aligns with US policy
items.summary:
- Yahoo has removed DEI pages from its corporate website, including the 2022 diversity report.
- Changes made between December 2024 and January 2025, resulting in a 60% reduction in site content.
- Other companies like Google, Meta, and Amazon have also altered their DEI content recently, reflecting industry-wide trends.
- Yahoo's spokesperson described the changes as part of a multi-phase redesign.
- The shift in DEI policies is tied to political transitions and regulatory pressures in the US.

items.title: SK Group chairman, TSMC chief discuss chip partnership
items.summary:
- SK Group Chairman Chey Tae-won met with TSMC CEO C.C. Wei to discuss semiconductor collaboration, especially in AI and HBM technology.
- This meeting follows a strategic partnership established in April 2024 between SK hynix and TSMC to enhance HBM production and advanced packaging.
- HBM technology is crucial for AI chip performance, and SK hynix holds over 50% of the global HBM market, with projected demand growing 82% annually through 2027.
- The competition in the semiconductor market is intensifying, with SK hynix narrowing the gap on Samsung in DRAM market share and potentially leading in next-gen HBM4 development.
- Micron Technology is also gaining market share amid competitive restructuring in the semiconductor market.

items.title: Uniqlo parent company posts $12.5b sales, record profit rise
items.summary:
- Fast Retailing, parent company of Uniqlo, reported record sales of ¥1.79 trillion (US$12.52 billion) for the six months ending in February, a 12% year-over-year increase.
- Operating profit grew 18.3% to ¥304.2 billion (US$2.13 billion), while net profit rose 19.2% to ¥233.5 billion (US$1.63 billion).
- The company anticipates operating profit to reach ¥545 billion (US$3.81 billion) and net profit to hit ¥410 billion (US$2.87 billion) for the full year.
- Domestic demand for Heattech garments and down jackets drove sales, with strong performance in Southeast Asia, North America, and Europe, despite declines in China and Hong Kong.

items.title: Tariffs may push Switch 2, PS5 prices to $590 in US
items.summary:
- Proposed tariffs could increase prices of the Switch 2 and PS5 in the US to $590.
- The tariffs are a response to ongoing trade tensions and may affect consumer electronics prices.
- The gaming industry is closely monitoring potential impacts on sales and market trends.

items.title: Computer parts maker Logitech withdraws 2026 forecast
Google lays off hundreds in platforms, devices division
Asia layoff tracker: latest on Microsoft JV in China, Aspire Indonesia
Shein gets UK IPO green light, awaits China’s final approval
items.summary:
- Shein has received approval from the UK’s Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) for its IPO in London.
- The company filed for the listing confidentially in June 2024 and awaits clearance from China's Securities Regulatory Commission (CSRC).
- Shein's valuation has dropped from a previous US$66 billion to an expected US$50 billion for the IPO due to market pressures and tariff impacts.
- Recent trade policy changes may affect Shein's pricing strategy in the US, which is its largest market.
- The CSRC’s approval may be delayed due to multiple regulatory bodies, pushing the IPO to later in 2025.
- Shein competes with Temu, which has a different business model and has expanded rapidly since its launch.
- Consumer concerns over inflation and tariffs may hinder Shein's growth post-IPO, as prices for fashion items are expected to rise.
- Shein's production is being diversified geographically, but this transition may take time to implement.

items.title: PUBG maker Krafton, Nvidia partners on AI game characters
items.summary:
- Krafton and Nvidia have announced a partnership to develop AI-driven game characters for PUBG.
- The collaboration aims to enhance player experiences by integrating advanced AI into game interactions.
- The partnership is expected to introduce new features that leverage Nvidia's graphics technology and AI capabilities.

items.title: Singapore’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- Singapore is recognized as a significant hub for tech startups, attracting substantial investor interest.
- An automated tracker is available to monitor the leading tech firms in Singapore regarding funding activities.
- The article emphasizes the difficulty in tracking funding activities due to the high volume of investments happening in the region.

items.title: LG Display finalizes $1.5b sale of China LCD plant to TCL
China unveils $8.2b AI fund to strengthen AI industry
items.summary:
- China announces a state fund worth 60 billion yuan (US$8.2 billion) for early-stage AI project investments.
- Launched by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT) and the Ministry of Finance to bolster the AI industry.
- Fund managed by Guozhi Investment in collaboration with the Big Fund, focusing on the entire AI supply chain.
- Initiative aligns with China's goal to enhance AI amid global competition and US semiconductor export restrictions.
- China accounted for 48% of global AI startup funding in 2017, showing its commitment to leading in AI technology.
- The fund aims to create a $150 billion AI industry by 2030, contributing to significant national economic projections.
keywords: Ministry of Industry and Information Technology

items.title: TikTok fuels ByteDance’s revenue to $155b
items.summary:
- ByteDance reported a 29% revenue increase for 2024, totaling US$155 billion.
- TikTok's global expansion contributed significantly, with international sales rising 63% to US$39 billion, representing 25% of total revenue.
- The company faced a deceleration in overall revenue growth compared to 2023, where revenue increased by 50% from US$80 billion to nearly US$120 billion.
- Douyin, ByteDance's flagship app, struggled due to China's economic slowdown, highlighting TikTok's vital role in revenue generation.
- TikTok users spend an average of 34 hours and 15 minutes on the app monthly, leading to substantial monetization opportunities and growing to 1.6 billion monthly active users by 2024.
- Geopolitical tensions, particularly US-China trade issues, pose risks to ByteDance's business model reliant on cross-border commerce.

items.title: Trump’s tariffs: Vietnam tightens dual-use export controls
items.summary:
• Vietnam addresses US trade concerns with new export controls on dual-use goods to prevent tariff evasions.
• The move follows scrutiny over Chinese goods re-exported with "Made in Vietnam" labels to bypass tariffs.
• A draft decree outlines new procedures for declaring and approving trade of sensitive products, coinciding with a temporary suspension of a 46% US tariff for 90 days.

items.title: Tesla halts Model S, Model X orders in China amid trade tensions
Myntra’s chief product, technology officer resigns
Singapore IT executive charged in US export fraud case
Sellers may raise prices on Chinese goods: Amazon CEO
Canva unveils new AI tools to attract enterprise clients
EU, China begin talks on EV pricing to replace tariffs
AI shopping app founder charged with fraud for using humans
Bitcoin life insurance firm Meanwhile nets $40m series A
Used Tesla listings surge 67% in March: report
Indian home services platform gets $60m IPO approval
Google cuts Workspace prices for US federal agencies
items.summary:
- Google announces a price reduction for Workspace business applications for US federal agencies.
- Discounts of up to 71% are effective until September 30, based on total government purchase volume, potentially saving up to $2 billion.
- The move aligns with the government's efforts to reduce spending and follows cost-cutting initiatives by the General Services Administration (GSA).

items.title: Tesla launches new long-range Cybertruck for $69,990
items.summary:
- Tesla has launched a new long-range Cybertruck variant priced at $69,990.
- This model is one of three variants available in the US market.
- The price reflects a significant increase from Tesla's initial 2019 announcement of a base model at $39,900.
- Cybertruck has strong demand, ranking among the top five selling EVs as of January 2025.
- The vehicle's distinctive angular design continues to attract attention in the crowded EV market.
- Consumer interest in EVs remains constrained, with many preferring hybrids or internal combustion engines due to cost concerns.

items.title: Swedish EV maker Polestar offers Tesla owners $20k discount
items.summary:
- Polestar is offering discounts of up to $20,000 to Tesla owners leasing its Polestar 3 model in the U.S.
- The campaign, which began in February and runs through April, aims to attract Tesla customers amid decreasing EV demand and tariff concerns.
- A long-range Polestar 3 is priced at approximately $93,000, with the discount lowering the lease cost to around $73,000, compared to Tesla's Model S starting at just under $80,000.
- Polestar’s discount strategy indicates a shift in the competitive landscape of the EV market as Tesla's sales decline while overall EV sales grow.
- The company missed its 2023 sales target, prompting a management restructuring and the need for urgent sales boosts.
- Polestar emphasizes the domestic production of the Polestar 3 as a marketing advantage amid new tariffs on imported vehicles.

items.title: Flipkart targets 800 quick commerce stores by 2025
items.author: Kalyan Krishnamurthy
items.summary:
- Flipkart plans to grow its Flipkart Minutes brand from 300 stores to nearly 800 by 2025.
- Demand for faster delivery is driven by affluent consumers in India’s top cities.
- Flipkart's user base exceeds 500 million across 95% of India’s pincodes.
- Competition in quick commerce is increasing, with players like Blinkit, Zepto, and Swiggy already well established.
- The quick commerce sector is projected to reach $9.95 billion by 2029, with a 16.60% CAGR.
- Significant financial losses reported by competitors like Swiggy Instamart and Zepto.
- The shift to rapid delivery services reflects changing consumer behavior prioritizing convenience.

items.title: UK AI startup Incident.io bags $62m series B
items.summary:
- London-based Incident.io raised $62 million in Series B funding led by Insight Partners, bringing total funding to over $96 million since its 2021 founding.
- The funds will be used to expand hiring, sales, and marketing efforts in London and San Francisco.
- Incident.io serves organizations with over 200 users, managing approximately 250,000 incidents; clients include Netflix, Etsy, and Ramp.

items.title: Israeli observability firm Groundcover nets $35m series B
items.summary:
- Groundcover has raised US$35 million in a series B funding round led by Zeev Ventures, totaling US$60 million since its founding in 2021.
- The company offers an alternative to established monitoring platforms and focuses on on-premise data control using eBPF technology for high-performance monitoring.
- The observability market is experiencing disruption due to rising costs from incumbent platforms, leading enterprises to seek cost-efficient alternatives like Groundcover's offerings.

items.title: US tariffs may cut Indonesia growth up to 0.5 percentage points
Waymo to begin first global test in Tokyo
Fore Coffee’s IPO oversubscribed by over 200x
HK fintech firm WeLab partners with HKIC to enhance AI
Fintech firm Block fined $40m for Cash App AML violations
items.summary:
- Block Inc. fined US$40 million for anti-money laundering compliance deficiencies related to its Cash App platform, announced on Apr. 10 by New York's financial services regulator.
- Settlement includes appointing an independent monitor to oversee compliance process improvements.
- The fine reflects a broader trend of increasing regulatory scrutiny on fintech companies, aligning with penalties historically faced by traditional banks for AML violations.

items.title: US stocks sink as tariffs on China rise to 145%
items.summary:
- US stocks fell sharply on Apr. 11 due to a tariff increase on Chinese imports to 145% from 125%.
- The Dow dropped nearly 1,700 points; S&P 500 and Nasdaq fell by 5% and almost 6%, respectively.
- China warned of a potential trade war unless talks are grounded in mutual respect.
- The increase includes a 20% tariff related to fentanyl trafficking, adding to earlier “reciprocal” duties.
- Tariffs could raise $400 billion but also increase consumer prices and inflation by 1-1.5%.
- The World Trade Organization warned that bilateral trade may drop by up to 80%.

items.title: Intel CEO’s past investments raise US security concerns
items.summary:
- Concerns arise over Intel CEO's previous investments potentially impacting US security.
- Investments in foreign companies scrutinized amidst geopolitical tensions.
- Calls for increased oversight on tech leadership and foreign ties.

items.title: Polish AI insurtech firm nets first investment at $220m valuation
items.summary:
- Ominimo, a Polish insurance startup, secured its first external funding through a strategic investment from Zurich Insurance Group.
- Zurich acquired a 5% stake in Ominimo for €10 million (approx. US$11 million), valuing the company at €200 million (US$220 million).
- Founded a year ago, Ominimo specializes in car insurance and has signed up 300,000 policies, achieving profitability.
- The company plans to expand into more than 10 markets, starting with Poland, Sweden, and the Netherlands.

items.title: OpenAI adds memory to ChatGPT for personalized user experience
From spark to surge: practical tips for scaling energy startups
Alphabet’s investment arm leads $58m funding in AI chip startup
items.summary:
- NEye Systems, based in Emeryville, California, raised $58 million led by CapitalG, Alphabet's growth-stage fund.
- The startup is developing optical circuit switch chips to enhance AI data centers' performance and energy efficiency.
- These chips transmit data via light, potentially reducing energy consumption significantly compared to traditional methods.

items.title: Apple shifts 1.5m India-made iPhones to US
items.summary:
- Apple has chartered cargo flights to transport 1.5 million iPhones from India to the US, totaling about 600 tons.
- This initiative aims to increase production in India and mitigate the effects of high tariffs on imports from China.
- Flights commenced in March, prompted by US tariffs on Chinese goods rising to 125%, while Indian imports have a lower tariff rate of 26%.
- Apple's strategy reflects a long-term pivot toward manufacturing diversification, a plan that began as early as 2018 to reduce reliance on China for production.
- Significant tariff differentials create competitive advantages in the smartphone market, giving companies like Samsung an edge due to their diversified manufacturing locations.
- Apple has developed a "green corridor" at Chennai airport, cutting customs clearance time from 30 to 6 hours to enhance logistics efficiency in response to tariff changes.
